The RIAA supports the creative + financial vitality of the American music business. | The Recording Industry Association of America¬Æ (RIAA) is the trade organization that supports and promotes the creative and financial vitality of the major music companies. Its members comprise the most vibrant record industry in the world, investing in great artists to help them reach their potential and connect to their fans. Nearly 85% of all legitimate recorded music produced and sold in the United States is created, manufactured or distributed by RIAA members.

The NO FAKES Act is crucial for protecting the rights to our voices and likenesses, helping to fight nonconsensual AI deepfakes and voice clones. üé∂ "As the music community embraces pro-artist, human-first uses of AI, the NO FAKES Act represents a huge step forward for smart, effective guardrails against irresponsible and unethical uses of these technologies. By returning to first principles and creating an enforceable new intellectual property right, the legislation lays the foundation for free market negotiations that will propel both innovation and safety forward in AI, not just for artists but for everyone," shared RIAA Chairman & CEO Mitch Glazier. Read more about how this act sets the stage for safe and innovative AI advancements. https://bit.ly/46rRdOa

The Human Artistry Campaign (a coalition of over 200 entertainment organizations) officially endorsed the NO FAKES Act that was just officially introduced today in the U.S. Senate. This legislation, importantly, would create an enforceable new federal intellectual property right allowing victims of nonconsensual deepfakes and voice clones to have them quickly taken down and recover damages. Yes, a rare bipartisan bill. And glad to see Senator Amy Klobuchar from my original great state of Minnesota, once again, helping to lead the charge on behalf of the Creative Community! https://lnkd.in/gitJ7NiS #ai #artificialintelligence #nofakes #media #entertainment #hollywood #humanartistrycampaign

Today, the Recording Industry Association of America¬Æ (RIAA) is reinforcing its commitment to protect artists and their creative works. We have filed significant copyright infringement lawsuits against Suno AI and Udio AI for using copyrighted sound recordings without permission. "Unlicensed services like Suno and Udio that exploit artists' works without consent or compensation hinder genuine innovation," states RIAA Chairman and CEO Mitch Glazier. "These are straightforward cases of copyright infringement involving unlicensed copying of sound recordings on a massive scale. Suno and Udio are attempting to hide the full scope of their infringement rather than putting their services on a sound and lawful footing," states RIAA Chief Legal Officer Ken Doroshow Read more about our efforts to safeguard artists' rights and promote responsible AI development in our official press release: https://bit.ly/3xwZBio

Congratulations to our very own Rose Connelly, SVP of Brand and Creative Strategy for earning a spot in the prestigious Leadership Music Class of 2025! Rose joins 45 other industry leaders in this esteemed program, which has built a network of over 1,400 graduates since it began in 1982. Leadership Music is dedicated to educating music professionals about all facets of the music business. We are thrilled for Rose and the contributions she will make alongside her fellow class members. #TeamRIAA is proud to have her join the ranks of our alumni program participants, including Jessica Richard, Ken Doroshow, and Carlos Linares, Karen Bell, and Susan Chertkof. Read more about Leadership Music and the incoming class in MusicRow: https://bit.ly/3xf0ZWP

Congratulations to our SVP of Federal Public Policy, Thomas Clees, for being named one of Billboard's #40Under40 for 2024! Your visionary leadership and humor continue to inspire all of us at #TeamRIAA. "As artificial intelligence (AI) proliferates, Tom, 35, is working to put guard rails in place through initiatives like the No AI Fraud Act, introduced in January. 'It is always thrilling and humbling to see an idea you helped to craft be debated on Capitol Hill,' he says, calling the bill 'something that is going to matter for a long time.'"
